posts.title: Vampiros lesbos
posts.excerpt: Review from DVDTalk: My first introduction to the oddball cinema of Spanish filmmaker Jesus ‘Jess’ Franco came one night about 3am while channel surfing in my parent’s basement. I’d just gotten back from college, it was time for the summer break, and I’d only minutes beforehand returned from an evening at the pub. I came …

posts._title: Nicolas Winding Refn – Only God Forgives (2013)
posts.title: Only God Forgives
posts.excerpt: Synopsis Julian, an American fugitive from justice, runs a boxing club in Bangkok as a front for his drug business. His mother, the head of a vast criminal organization, arrives from the US to collect the body of her favorite son, Billy. Julian’s brother has just been killed after having savagely murdered a young prostitute. …

posts._title: Jim Jarmusch – Only Lovers Left Alive (2013)
posts.title: Only Lovers Left Alive
posts.excerpt: Noted indie director Jim Jarmusch directs the vampire story Only Lovers Left Alive. Tom Hiddleston stars as Adam, a bloodsucker who makes a living as a reclusive musician. posts._title: History Channel – Sex in ’69: The Sexual Revolution in America  (2009)
posts.title: Sex in ’69: The Sexual Revolution in America
posts.excerpt: Travel back to 1969 and uncover fascinating trends, people and events that forever changed the way Americans think about and have sex. Viewers will travel from the Playboy Penthouse in Los Angeles to San Francisco’s Hippie crash pads, the boardwalk in Atlantic City, a court room in Miami, and other spots across America to meet …

posts._title: Joel Coen & Ethan Coen – Inside Llewyn Davis (2013)
posts.title: Inside Llewyn Davis
posts.excerpt: Synopsis INSIDE LLEWYN DAVIS follows a week in the life of a young folk singer as he navigates the Greenwich Village folk scene of 1961. Llewyn Davis (Oscar Isaac) is at a crossroads. Guitar in tow, huddled against the unforgiving New York winter, he is struggling to make it as a musician against seemingly insurmountable …

posts.title: Antonieta
posts.excerpt: Moving back and forth between present and past, Antonieta tells the story of Antonieta Rivas Mercado – a writer, social activist, and important patron of the arts – against a backdrop of the political turmoils of the Mexican Revolution and its aftermath.

posts._title: Various – Vlyublenniye v Kiev AKA Lovers in Kiev (2011)
posts.title: Vlyublenniye v Kiev
posts.excerpt: Three words. Just three words, and perhaps most important in the world have become the dumbest, even to say them disgusting. “I love you” – shit… They have been meaning nothing, but serve only a cover for, you know, all kind of dirty tricks. Well, how many chicks were fucked and left in the morning? …

posts.title: VHS – Kahloucha
posts.excerpt: Moncef Kahloucha is a fan of ’70s genre movies, especially those with Bruce Lee, Jim Kelly and Clint Eastwood. Apart from working as a house painter in Kazmet, a poor Tunician locality, Kahloucha is a tenacious director, actor, screenwriter and prop master in his own zero-budget productions. At the limits of communal, visceral cinema captured …
